concept.title: Enable Login to APP and Service Controllers

section.p: In order to be able to login to the Asynchronous Provisioning Platform (APP) and its service controllers, some settings have to be made in the administration portal:

ol.li: Choose Manage organization in the Operation menu.
Enter PLATFORM_OPERATOR in the Organization ID field.
Enable the following organization roles: Supplier and Technology provider.
Fill in the mandatory fields (red asterisks).
Go to the Account menu and choose Manage users.
Log out of the administration portal and log in again to enable the changes.

Now you can log in to APP and change APP-specific settings:
https://<hostname.fqdn>:8881/oscm-app/
User name: administrator
Password: admin123

You can also login to the instance status interface of each service controller:
https://<hostname.fqdn>:8881/oscm-app-<controller-name>/
User name: administrator
Password: admin123
<controller-name> is either openstack, aws, or vmware.
For the VMware controller, for example, it is required to specify the following:
Connection URL: The URL for accessing the vSphere API.
User ID: The ID of the technical user in vSphere for accessing the vSphere API.
Password: The password of the technical user in vSphere for accessing the vSphere API.
